segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, but she doesn’t even notice it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, yet she keeps polishing that same plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s even aware of the mess spreading across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s totally oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, the stool is about to tip, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should warn her before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is already seeping into the cabinets, and she still hasn’t turned around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting at her to wake up and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
